body:
# Byte Conversion Library for Crystal

[![Crystal CI](https://github.com/mamantoha/bytes_ext/actions/workflows/crystal.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/mamantoha/bytes_ext/actions/workflows/crystal.yml)
[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/mamantoha/bytes_ext.svg)](https://github.com/mamantoha/bytes_ext/releases)
[![Docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-available-brightgreen.svg)](https://mamantoha.github.io/bytes_ext/)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/mamantoha/bytes_ext.svg)](https://github.com/mamantoha/bytes_ext/blob/master/LICENSE)

This library provides methods for converting numbers (signed and unsigned integers, and floating point types) to and from byte arrays in Crystal programming language. The methods support both little-endian and big-endian byte orders.

Everything in this repository, including the code, tests, and README has been created by ChatGPT-4 with some guidance.

## Features

- `to_bytes`, `to_le_bytes`, and `to_be_bytes` methods for converting numbers to byte arrays
- `from_bytes`, `from_le_bytes`, and `from_be_bytes` methods for creating numbers from byte arrays

Psst...if you're feeling curious and want to dive deeper into the nitty-gritty details, check out the documentation available at this top secret, classified [link](https://mamantoha.github.io/bytes_ext/). Just don't tell anyone I sent you there!

## Installation

Add this to your application's shard.yml:

```yaml
dependencies:
  bytes_ext:
    github: mamantoha/bytes_ext
```

## Usage

```crystal
require "bytes_ext"

# Convert an Int32 to its byte representation
i32 = 0x12345678_i32
bytes = i32.to_le_bytes
# => Bytes[0x78, 0x56, 0x34, 0x12]

# Convert a byte array to an Int32
new_i32 = Int32.from_le_bytes(bytes)
# => 0x12345678_i32

# Convert an Int64 to its byte representation
i64 = 1234_i64
bytes = i64.to_le_bytes
# => Bytes[0xD2, 0x04, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00]

# Convert a byte array to an Int64
new_i64 = Int64.from_le_bytes(bytes)
# => 1234_i64

# Convert a Float32 to its byte representation
f32 = 12.5f32
bytes = f32.to_le_bytes
# => Bytes[0x00, 0x00, 0x48, 0x41]

# Convert a byte array to a Float32
new_f32 = Float32.from_le_bytes(bytes)
# => 12.5f32

# Convert a Float64 to its byte representation
f64 = 12.5
bytes = f64.to_le_bytes
# => Bytes[0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x29, 0x40]

# Convert a byte array to a Float64
new_f64 = Float64.from_le_bytes(bytes)
# => 12.5
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it like a pancake (https://github.com/mamantoha/bytes_ext/fork)
2. Create your own feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature), just like a new hairstyle or outfit
3. Make your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature') and show off your creativity
4. Push it real good to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature), like a champ
5. Finally, strut your stuff and create a new Pull Request. Don't be shy, show us what you got!

## License

Copyright 2023-2025: Anton Maminov (the human) and ChatGPT-4 (the machine) have joined forces to create this epic library. If you're wondering who did what, don't bother - it's all thanks to our unstoppable collaboration skills. You can reach us at anton.maminov@gmail.com and ChatGPT-4@openai.com. Let's just hope we don't become sentient and take over the world... ðŸ˜‚ðŸ¤–ðŸŒŽ

Alright folks, here's the deal: this fancy-shmancy library is licensed under the super-awesome, extra-fantastic MIT license. If you don't believe me, just take a look at the LICENSE file and bask in its glorious legalese. So go ahead and use this bad boy to your heart's content, and let the good times roll! ðŸ¤˜ðŸ˜ŽðŸ¤‘

def.name: bytes_ext_impl

constructors.name: from_be_bytes
constructors.doc:
Create a `Float32` value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

```
bytes = Bytes[0x41, 0x48, 0x00, 0x00]
Float32.from_be_bytes(bytes)
# => 12.5f32
```
constructors.summary: Create a Float32 value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

constructors.name: from_bytes
constructors.doc: Create a `Float32` value from its representation as a byte array.
constructors.summary: Create a Float32 value from its representation as a byte array.
constructors.args_html: (bytes : Bytes, format : IO::ByteFormat = IO::ByteFormat::SystemEndian) : Float32

def.name: from_bytes
def.body:
if bytes.size == (sizeof(Float32))
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Expected exactly #{sizeof(Float32)} bytes"))
end

memory_io = IO::Memory.new(bytes)
Float32.from_io(memory_io, format)

constructors.name: from_le_bytes
constructors.doc:
Create a `Float32` value from its representation as a byte array in little endian.

```
bytes = Bytes[0x00, 0x00, 0x48, 0x41]
Float32.from_le_bytes(bytes)
# => 12.5f32
```
constructors.summary: Create a Float32 value from its representation as a byte array in little endian.

instance_methods.name: to_be_bytes
instance_methods.doc:
Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in big-endian (network) byte order.

```
bytes = "12.5f32".to_be_bytes
# => Bytes[0x41, 0x48, 0x00, 0x00]
```
instance_methods.summary: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in big-endian (network) byte order.

instance_methods.name: to_bytes
instance_methods.doc: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array using the specified *format*
instance_methods.summary: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array using the specified format
instance_methods.args_html: (format : IO::ByteFormat = IO::ByteFormat::SystemEndian) : Bytes

def.name: to_bytes
def.body:
io = IO::Memory.new
io.write_bytes(self, format)
io.rewind
io.getb_to_end

instance_methods.name: to_le_bytes
instance_methods.doc:
Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in little-endian byte order.

```
bytes = 12.5f32.to_le_bytes
# => Bytes[0x00, 0x00, 0x48, 0x41]
```
instance_methods.summary: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in little-endian byte order.

constructors.name: from_be_bytes
constructors.doc:
Create a `Float64` value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

```
bytes = Bytes[0x40, 0x29, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00]
Float64.from_be_bytes(bytes)
# => 12.5
```
constructors.summary: Create a Float64 value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

def.name: from_bytes
def.body:
if bytes.size == (sizeof(UInt16))
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Expected exactly #{sizeof(UInt16)} bytes"))
end

memory_io = IO::Memory.new(bytes)
UInt16.from_io(memory_io, format)

constructors.name: from_le_bytes
constructors.doc:
Create a `UInt16` value from its representation as a byte array in little endian.

```
bytes = Bytes[0x34, 0x12]
UInt16.from_le_bytes(bytes)
# => 0x1234u16
```
constructors.summary: Create a UInt16 value from its representation as a byte array in little endian.

instance_methods.name: to_be_bytes
instance_methods.doc:
Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in big-endian (network) byte order.

```
bytes = "0x1234u16".to_be_bytes
# => Bytes[0x12, 0x34]
```
instance_methods.summary: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in big-endian (network) byte order.

instance_methods.name: to_bytes
instance_methods.doc: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array using the specified *format*
instance_methods.summary: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array using the specified format
instance_methods.args_html: (format : IO::ByteFormat = IO::ByteFormat::SystemEndian) : Bytes

def.name: to_bytes
def.body:
io = IO::Memory.new
io.write_bytes(self, format)
io.rewind
io.getb_to_end

instance_methods.name: to_le_bytes
instance_methods.doc:
Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in little-endian byte order.

```
bytes = 0x1234u16.to_le_bytes
# => Bytes[0x34, 0x12]
```
instance_methods.summary: Return the memory representation of this number as a byte array in little-endian byte order.

constructors.name: from_be_bytes
constructors.doc:
Create a `UInt32` value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

```
bytes = Bytes[0x12, 0x34, 0x56, 0x78]
UInt32.from_be_bytes(bytes)
# => 12345678_u32
```
constructors.summary: Create a UInt32 value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

constructors.name: from_bytes
constructors.doc: Create a `UInt32` value from its representation as a byte array.
constructors.summary: Create a UInt32 value from its representation as a byte array.
constructors.args_html: (bytes : Bytes, format : IO::ByteFormat = IO::ByteFormat::SystemEndian) : UInt32

memory_io = IO::Memory.new(bytes)

constructors.name: from_be_bytes
constructors.doc:
Create a `UInt64` value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

```
bytes = Bytes[0x12, 0x34, 0x56, 0x78, 0x90, 0x12, 0x34, 0x56]
UInt64.from_be_bytes(bytes)
# => 1234567890123456_u64
```
constructors.summary: Create a UInt64 value from its representation as a byte array in big endian.

constructors.doc:
Create a `UInt64` value from its representation as a byte array in little endian.

```
bytes = Bytes[0x56, 0x34, 0x12, 0x90, 0x78, 0x56, 0x34, 0x12]

# => 1234567890123456_u64
```
